definition: abbr. for the Philippines 菲律賓|菲律宾[Fei1 lu:4 bin1]
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself

sentences.english: You are an excellent student, you should give yourself credit.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個很優秀的學生，千萬不要妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: I pity anyone who has to feed a family on such a low income.
sentences.chinese: 我憐憫任何必要以如此菲薄的收益養活百口的人。

sentences.english: Do not undermine your worth by comparing yourself with others.
sentences.chinese: 不要跟人攀比而妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: I swear that, from now on, I will treasure rather than underestimate myself.
sentences.chinese: 我宣誓，從今往後，讓我珍視自己不再妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: England has been too modest in the matter of Wellington.
sentences.chinese: 英格蘭在威靈頓眼前過於妄自菲薄了。

sentences.english: Prince, please forgive this shabby present.
sentences.chinese: 殿下，請原諒我獻上這般菲薄的禮品。

sentences.english: The low salary did not dispose him to accept the position.
sentences.chinese: 菲薄的待遇使他不想接受這項工作。

sentences.english: Outworkers in the clothing industry are usually badly paid.
sentences.chinese: 服裝業中的外包工通常工酬菲薄。

sentences.english: The saying that beauty is but skin-deep is but a skin-deep saying.
sentences.chinese: “美不過是菲薄之物”這句話自身就是菲薄的。

sentences.english: The saying that beauty is but skin-deep is but a skin-deep saying.
sentences.chinese: “美不過是菲薄之物”這句話自身就是菲薄的。

sentences.english: Have you limited yourself by saying you are not smart enough?
sentences.chinese: 你是否覺得自己不夠聰明而妄自菲薄？

sentences.english: That year there were fewer temporary teachers to plug in London because of low pay.
sentences.chinese: 由於待遇菲薄，那年倫敦僱用得到的臨時教師更少了。

sentences.english: Shguide men haudio-videoe faith in luck. Self-trust is the first secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 菲薄的人信賴運氣，而告捷的第一祕訣是自信。

sentences.english: The final benefit in my list is far from trivial.
sentences.chinese: 最後的收益是不會妄自菲薄。

definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
to float about/(of a feeling) to show on the face/(of speech, friendship etc) shallow/vague
to boast/to blow one's own horn
